articles.description: Douglas County's jump in cases coincided with an increase in testing: the number of people tested in the county rose by more than 72% over the last week, from more
articles.content:
Health officials reported three COVID-19 deaths in Nebraska on Saturday, bringing to 76 the total number of deaths in the state.
One death was reported in Dakota County and two in Adams County.
In Adams County, a woman in her 90s and a man in his 80s, both … [+4120 chars]

articles.title: Midland confirms two more coronavirus cases Saturday - Midland Daily News
articles.description:
Midland added two confirmed coronavirus cases Saturday, May 2, bringing the total number of cases to 62 in the county. The number of coronavirus deaths remains at six.

articles.title: Inside the extraordinary race to invent a coronavirus vaccine - msnNOW
articles.description: Companies are launching vaccine trials at an unprecedented pace, but some are worried about the trade-offs between speed and safety.
articles.content:
Ian Haydon, a healthy 29-year-old, reported to a medical clinic in Seattle for a momentous blood draw last week. 
Oh yeah, said the nurse taking his blood. That is liquid gold.

articles.title: Alaska reports 1 new COVID-19 diagnosis, 7 more recoveries - KTVA
articles.description: The Alaska Department of Health and Social Services reports Saturday that only one additional person in the state has tested positive for COVID-19, and seven more Alaskans have recovered.
articles.content:

articles.description: Residents and leaders of one mountain county are mourning the loss of a friend and colleague. Transylvania County Commissioner Will Cathey died on April 30. He was elected to the board in 2018. Cathey was also formerly mayor of Rosman and an assistant distric…

articles.author: Dale Smith
articles.title: Antibody tests the key to opening society back up? What you need to know - CNET
articles.description: Tests that detect whether you've recovered from COVID-19 might help reopen cities and the economy. Here's how they work.
articles.content:
Antibody testing looks for evidence that a person has been infected with the coronavirus SARS-CoV-2, but not the virus itself.
James Martin/CNET
For the most up-to-date news and information about the coronavirus pandemic, visit the WHO website.
